website_summaries.verdict: Those who needed stability and support were generally happy with the performance of the Asics Gel Kayano 22. A cloud-like underfoot experience was described by quite a number of testers. For them, it gave a solid time on the asphalt. But there are caveats associated with this, including an apparently narrow toe box, a flimsy inner lining, and a rather bland design.
pros: Wearers appreciated the adaptive stretchable mesh used in the upper unit of the Asics Gel Kayano 22 because it covered their feet securely
Several users wrote that they were able to get compliments because of the colorful design of the upper
Some testers observed that the mid-sole unit didn’t break down easily, even after many uses
Those with narrow foot-dimensions and slim feet in general felt welcome when they wore this shoe
A runner stated that dirt came off easily from the external façade when it was cleaned
Most runners commended the excellent blend of cushioning and stability found in the underfoot platform
The platform felt like ‘clouds’ to several reviewers
they felt that it was responsive and springy
cons: There were testers who complained that the upper unit—particularly the toe box—felt uncomfortably narrow and tight
A reviewer thought that the cushioning wasn’t very efficient because they began to notice some knee pain after two weeks of use
The inner fabric used in the heel area wore off on several runners
It caused skin irritation and, eventually, blistering
The overall design of this model didn’t seem very appealing to some consumers

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and perfect for heavy runners
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. I'm a big guy, about 6'4" 225lbs and these are perfect. A big heel to help distribute my weight evenly as I lumber on the treadmill. These are also my second pair of the 22's. For some reason I feel like ASIC only gets every other model right. Love these and hated the 21's. And loved the 20's and hated the 19's. If you're on the heavy side or kinda stomp when you run, these are amazing. Great fit and very, very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed! Time to change shoe brands!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has worn Asics for YEARS. They were normally worth the extra price but these lasted under 8 months! The heels are completely separated from the shoe!! If we have to buy new ones every 7 to 8 months we will get a cheaper shoe! I hate that Asics has been so crappy lately. My sis n law has had same issues with hers falling aprart in 6 or 7 months and she gets hers from the store not online so I don't think its an Amazon/Online problem. Asics has gone to cheap materials and workmanship so its time for a new brand! They were a great brand for many years-We will miss them:( UNHAPPY!
customer_reviews.author: Kimmi Bear

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Cheap fabric used
customer_reviews.text: The shoe has a hole in the heel area on both sneakers, im very disappointed in asics i thought their product would last longer without messing up. The fabric they use on the inside is extremely cheap and will wear away. I also dont use the shoes that much only 4 times for about 2 hours a week just to workout. It is extremely uncomfortable every step you take you can feel the unevenness and scratching on your heel...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you're not running hundreds of miles in them they are probably fine, but if you want an authentic product and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned about a dozen pairs of this shoe purchased from running stores. I decided to save a few bucks and try Amazon. These shoes were different fit and very slightly different style. After owning so many pairs of this shoe and running thousands of miles in this style over the last three years, I'm convinced these are knock offs and returned them. If you're not running hundreds of miles in them they are probably fine, but if you want an authentic product and performance, looks elsewhere. Amazing needs to do something to protect consumers from fake goods, but in the mean time, is go elsewheee for this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon buyer

customer_reviews.title: I like having 2 pairs to rotate
customer_reviews.text: I usually never have a problem wearing a men's or women's Asic. As a matter of fact, I was wearing a men's 7 GEL-Kayano 22 AND a newer pair of women's GEL-Kayano 22's, but the men's was older and starting to wear down. I like having 2 pairs to rotate. I was really bummed when the men's you sent did NOT fit--too small especially in the toe box. I returned them--no problem. Found a new pair of GEL-Kayano 23's at Nordstrom for $99.95 (much better deal) plus I had a $25 a gift certificate so my feet are happy again.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Tuffley

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Husband says nothing is a 5, he had the navy blue with gold trim from an earlier year and loved them. The blue this year had a purple cast and was a no go. So I ordered the black, very nice. I personally would like to ask ASICS who is coming up with the colors??? My kids are even having a hard time wrapping their heads around the wild colors. These are a great shoe heal cup hugs and therefore doesn't get ripped up, great cushioning for casual wear and all around walking, biking, hiking. Can't say anything about running as we are not runners.
customer_reviews.author: mamabear

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! At first..
customer_reviews.text: I had always wanted a pair of ASICS and these were the most comfortable shoes i had ever had....for about 3 1/2 months. The inside of both heels began to tear up, making them uncomfortable to have on for long periods of time, which was unfortunate because i bought them to wear at work. I have since retired these. Admittedly, i bought another pair of ASICS, despite the bad luck and no response from the manufacturer. I guess im hooked! These are the replacements, which i definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: S. Blaker

customer_reviews.title: I bought these to replace my tired Nike Monarch Vs which I love but didn't know how terrible they truly were until ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Frito lay vendor and I walk, a lot. On hard grocery store floors kneeling, reaching, bending, twisting, climbing and squatting for 10-12 hours 5 days a week. I bought these to replace my tired Nike Monarch Vs which I love but didn't know how terrible they truly were until I put these on. Plantar fasciitis, Gone Knee pain, Gone Lower back pain, Gone. Bottom line is if you're on your feet most of the day on hard flat surfaces, you're gonna want to give these a try.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Vela

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Have used the Kayano for years, was a little reluctant to go to the 22 as I'd heard the toe box was smaller. It did seem tighter when I first put it on but broke in very quickly and fits great now. I compared it to a version of the 21 and actually feel like this one gives me more arch support, which is great for me. If you've had good luck with the Kayano in the past I'd recommend this version without any reservations. I've probably put on about 30 miles so far and have had no issues at all, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jake S

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a nice shoe. My arches fall in just a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: I just recently got into running. The first shoe I ran with what the Kayano 23. I decided to give these a try to save some money. Definitely a nice shoe. My arches fall in just a bit and this shoe has great arch support. Also a wide toe box for people like me who have fat toes. I don't really have any complaints. I will say I did prefer the Kayano 23 over the 22, now that the price has come down a bit I will be switching back. The 23 has firmer foam in the mid foot. If you tend to break down the arches in shoe very quickly like I do, I would suggest the 23.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Williams

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've been using ASICS GEL-Kayano for years. My foot is just one click below a "wide" size, meaning I don't need to actually buy wide-sized shoes, but it's close and if the shoe runs narrow, as many running shoes seem to do, it will be tight on . me. The Kayano seems a tad wider and so it fits my foot perfectly. It is light yet durable and I am almost 50 and have no problems with my feet or legs.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lees

customer_reviews.title: My new FAVORITE running/walking shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a newbie to walking/jogging and have had TERRIBLE pain with my feet (Plantar Fasciitis). I've worn Nike's FlyKnits, and other shoes all with no support and causing my pain while jogging/running. I read an online review on these and I decided it was time to try another brand other than Nike (which I've been loyal to all 40yrs of my life!). I am AMAZED by how well the show fits and how comfortable they are. Been jogging in them for 1 week and I can say that my Plantar Fasciitis has actually gotten a little better from wearing these Asics Kayano 22's. I highly recommend this shoe for guys with over-pronation and Plantar Fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: JE

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problem
customer_reviews.text: I developed Plantar fascitis (feels like pebble under heel) and was hoping these shoes could relieve the pain. They do. I wear an 8 1/2 dress shoe but for athletic shoes I find I need a size 9, so that is what I ordered. The length seems fine but the toes feel cramped. The shoe is very cushy and I don't feel any pain when walking, so they are doing what I needed them to do. I wear them to work, so I wish they had a style without all the decorations. I got the black, which is as plain as they offer, but is has a lot of silver swirls on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The vibrant yellow color is absolutely madness great! The best feature
customer_reviews.text: By far the nicest running shoes I've owned. The vibrant yellow color is absolutely madness great! The best feature, of course, is the support and comfort feeling when running. I over pronate so these Kayano 22 actually releases that tension and aids to correct my steps. My only recommendation is that if you are not the skinny, little bitty type of RUNNER, you need to get a WIDE size. I'm 9-1/2", the length is correct but it's too tight on the sides. So please, get a wider factor
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J

customer_reviews.title: it is pretty well known that the kayak 22 series runs a ...
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews, it is pretty well known that the kayak 22 series runs a little smaller than previous kayano shoes. However for me this was perfect because I was always in-between sizes. Fits great and provides support to the balls of my feet like no other asics does. I have morton's neuroma that flares up every time I run more than once a week, but in kayanos it does MUCH better. Pricey but look for a good deal and grab some kayanos. For what it's worth I have not tried any other brand of running shoes. Nike seems to be all style and not as comfy when I try them on. Never tried brooks or other brands.
customer_reviews.author: jallove7

customer_reviews.title: Great, Comfortable, Quality!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were exactly what I needed. I was scared of the complaints about running too small so I ordered a half size larger and they fit perfectly. I was also worried about the lack of "breathing" from comments I've read but I have not experienced hot feet whatsoever. I've worn them every day since getting them and haven't had sweaty feet once. I even ran a few miles and my feet didn't feel super hot at anytime (it was 85 degrees outside!). I highly recommend these shoes for those suffering from plantar faciitis. These have really helped.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: ASICS Men's Gel-Kayano 22 Running Shoe-Order Up!
customer_reviews.text: Had heard these run a bit small, so ordeted size 12 instead of 11.5 and they fit fine. If you have very wide feet, they may feel a bit snug on your feet. Ordered the red/combo color, (the red is a true red), which have gotten many compliments, and recipient has only good things to say: *I haven't even gotten a blister breaking them in, but I'm glad I ordered a half size up. " Definitely worth the cost. Get a pair whle in stock!
customer_reviews.author: Chatalia

customer_reviews.title: Helped cure my plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I tried many things for my plantar fasciitis and nothing seemed to work. After owning and wearing Nike air sneakers for years, I strongly believe that they are the reason for my condition. I read many reviews on sneakers and saw many about asics hemoing with plantar fasciitis so I decided to get these and like many other people I have no more pain because if these sneakers. They cured me and I am no longer a nike brand owner. They are horrible for the feet. Asics rock. These sneakers do feel like I am floating on air.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Hurt My Feet
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis and purchased these shoes because they were a top 3 recommendation of shoes to buy (if not the top recommendation). I purchased these and also the Saucony Men's Guide 7 Running Shoe and wore them both off and on for maybe a month. My foot constantly hurt while wearing the ASICS and was extremely disappointed that I paid well over $100 for a pair of shoes that I eventually gave away - they were a good looking pair of shoes though if that's the only thing you want. The Sauconys were very comfortable from the very first time I wore them and I'll buy them again. I just wished they looked as good as the ASICS.
customer_reviews.author: Doug P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered my second pair of these shoes. I actually use them as cross-trainers for my gym workout, as I use specific walking shoes for my power walks (alas, my running days ended with my last knee surgery). They are comfortable and provide excellent support, including the arches. I am very particular about my footwear, and have used these since my long-time brand (New Balance) began building their shoes with less support and cushioning. I think this model is to be replaced soon, so order a pair while you can if you think they will meet your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Whitecliff

customer_reviews.title: I don't really like the new mesh that they've put on the shoe
customer_reviews.text: I don't really like the new mesh that they've put on the shoe. It's tough to tell how they look from the pictures when you get them and though it may be more "techy" synthetic material, it looks a little cheap. I'd say to check them out in the store first if you have time and then decide. I've bought these exact shoes for more than 10 years now so I can speak from quite a few pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Keahu Kahuanui

customer_reviews.title: Won't miss these
customer_reviews.text: These Kayanos are ok but not great. I really liked the 21s, they seemed to fit better and the uppers were much higher quality. The uppers on these 22s seems cheap and thin, they don't help with the structure of the shoe so they don't fit as well. I'm a long time ASICS wearer, I just counted, over 30 pairs so far. For reference my favorites have been the Evolutions, followed by GT-2000s and the old 2100 series. Kayanos would be better if they were more consistently better made. Latest purchase was a pair of Foundations. For the exact same size, 13 2E, the Foundations are noticeably wider in the toe box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite walking and all around sneaker
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased for my son, but they were too big so I had to return them. However, I've owned 3 pairs of Gel Kayanos over the years. They are billed as a running shoe, but you will not find a better walking shoe. My current pair was purchased in 2014 for a trip to Disney World and they're finally just to the point of needing to be replaced. They're true to size, durable, and are extremely cushioned.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Fit like a glove - Extremely comfortable - Love 'em!
customer_reviews.text: I love ASICS running shoes. They fit like a glove, are extremely comfortable, and need no break-in period - assuming you buy the right model and size. (I normally wear size 9-1/2 shoes, but I've had some ASICS shoes that I had to go to a size 10)
customer_reviews.author: DAVE KROMER

customer_reviews.title: Excellent running shoe!!
customer_reviews.text: Fit is just as good as my 21's. I was concerned about the number of comments complaining about the toe box being too small...but it doesn't effect my fit at all. I love running outdoors, but for years suffered from shin splints; at 200+ lbs body weight I need extra protection to my feet and joints....the Gel Kayano's are the first shoe to totally eliminate those problem for me...no pain!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: ASICS failed with this model.
customer_reviews.text: Terribly disappointing. The Kayano 21 and 20 is one of the best running shoes on the planet for those of us who need stability shoes. it did not need to be changed. Why "improve" something that is already great, particularly if the "improvements" result in making it a far less reliable stability shoe. Two weeks of running in this shoe resulted in significant achilles pain, and a pair of shoes I could not return because they were worn already. Ended up buying another pair of 21s, and life was good again.
customer_reviews.author: rockymtnhigh

customer_reviews.title: I love Asics; I really can't wear any other brand ...
customer_reviews.text: I love Asics; I really can't wear any other brand since I have a somewhat wide foot and flat feet. The fact that most Asics have a stiffer arch and softer outside really help them be comfortable. I tried The Kayano's on in the store and instantly was sold on them. I ended up buying them on Amazon to get the color I wanted and cheaper price. After about 2 weeks of daily use, the arch gave out and my legs were pronating badly while wearing them which caused pain and made the shoe extremely uncomfortable. I won't buy the Kayano again and will stick with my Gel Kahana which lasts much longer wiithout the wear issue.
customer_reviews.author: Nick K6

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cushion great feel
customer_reviews.text: I love the Kayano's. While I've tried many brands of shoes, Asics have proven to be best for me. I have very flat feet and other shoes I've tried just leave my feet, legs, knees really hurting after running, etc. The Kayano's have amazing cushion and absorb a ton of shock. I just picked up another pair of Asics Gel Quantum. Those are very similar to the Kayano. I guess it just comes down to personal preference, but for me, the Kayano's and the Quantums feel great. I rotate between the two for runs. If you don't like a lot of cushion I wouldn't purchase these.
customer_reviews.author: Swil75

customer_reviews.title: Best Running Shoe I've ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended to me by a friend who is a competitive runner based on my running needs and level of pronation and I will say: Best Running Shoe I have ever worn. Very comfortable and cushioned, but still able to feel the road (some running shoes are so cushioned you don't get the feedback of your foot hitting pavement and that messes up my gate). Mine have held up very well, I will be buying another pair as these have started to get up there in miles!
customer_reviews.author: B.F. Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Superior Asics shoes
customer_reviews.text: I'll never buy shoes that aren't ASICS Gel Kayano shoes for exercise. They're so supportive of the foot. I did, unfortunately, think that my package had been lost after over a month of waiting for the package so I had to buy a cheap pair of sneaks to do a 5k and I was dying in them.The range of Asics is surprising, but I highly recommend the Kayano; spend the money and your feet will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes for whatever you want to do
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fan of the Kayanos. It's my 4th pair and they all fit very well and are great for running or training. Even if you don't do any kind of sport they are much more comfortable than the other shoes I had (I had Mizunos, Nikes, Adidas, New Balances and they aren't even close to this). Also, all Asics Kayanos I had lasted 2 years and I got rid of them because I was tired to see them there. One thing, for other brands I use 9.5 but for these guys I had to go with 10. Can't go wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: Camacho

customer_reviews.title: After little over a month of use the fabric covering ...
customer_reviews.text: After little over a month of use the fabric covering the heel started to tear on BOTH heels. On one of the heels it has even gotten past the second layer of fabric. You'd think a pair of $120 shoes would be more durable... I got these soley for the reason that I thought they would last me at least a year. If you get these prepare to throw a lot of money down the drain
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer12345

customer_reviews.title: I need a running shoe with good motion control
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis. I need a running shoe with good motion control. I have been using Asics shoes with duo max sole for several years now. The lastest Kayano 22 is another solid shoe. I usually run 3.5 miles three days a week. With other shoes, my arch falls, my achilles tendon stretches and hurts, which leads to sore calves and back pain. With a combination of running in these shoes and stretching regularly, I am able to get out and run to keep myself healthy and in shape. I highly recommend these for anyone that has plantar fasciitis or needs a solid motion control shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Stalaris

customer_reviews.title: 215lbs and by no means your stereotypical runner although I love the idea of being a runner
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6', 215lbs and by no means your stereotypical runner although I love the idea of being a runner. However my shins would be on fire after short distances. I took the plunge and bought these after the positive reviews and they didn't disappoint. They truley feel like running on clouds. I was able to finish my first 5k and didn't have any issues with my legs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Athletic Shoes for Flat Feet
customer_reviews.text: My husband has incredibly flat feet, and these shoes are perfect for him. Because he is very physically active, and has had so much trouble with other athletic shoes in the past, we shopped specifically for shoes that are intended for flat feet. His feet are also a little wide, and these fit him quite well. He can wear them all day without sacrificing comfort, has no problems during workouts, and the color is true to the picture. All that being said, these probably wouldn't be ideal for someone with higher arches.
customer_reviews.author: jet.elana

customer_reviews.title: Asics shoes fit well, but don’t last.
customer_reviews.text: Edit after one year: Holes in heel area of shoe started appearing after 6 months of use and now I see worn areas in other areas of the shoe. I expected an ASICS shoe to use better quality materials to last longer but it isn’t the case unfortunately. I’m taking 2 stars s off review. Original review after I bought them: It took a couple days walking with them to break them in but they are so comfortable now. I do a lot of walking at work so I needed good shoes such as these Asics.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes but lack durability
customer_reviews.text: I love ASICS running shoes because they are available in unusual wide sizes (13.5 4E) for big feet. This is my fourth pair of ASICS (Nimbus or Kayano) in the past four years and I've developed a loyalty to the shoes because they have delivered a consistent quality. These shoes still fit well and perform as advertised, however they are much more cheaply made than their predecessors. The ASICS logo quickly detached from the mesh and the mesh, which has little or no stretch, split along the side. I got about 4 months out of them with only moderate use and will use their predecessors while I look for a different pair.
customer_reviews.author: Keri P

customer_reviews.title: Since I wear a size 10 I decided to try the men's version and see if that fit better. Fit was a too big/wide
customer_reviews.text: I normally order women's shoes (I am a woman, afterall), but the women's version fit extremely tight. Since I wear a size 10 I decided to try the men's version and see if that fit better. Fit was a too big/wide, so I had to return. I've had the Gel Kayano for the past 10 years and I feel like ASICS messed with this version too much. Fit was much different than previous years. Disappointing, but still love these shoes. Will try again next year!
customer_reviews.author: Emilia

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: So far great shoes, I am a big fan of asics. I had a pair of gel-tornados and then the tr1 and 2 craze shoes (tr3 I ordered and sent back due to not only being to narrow but looking like crap for the price). They all held up well and these look to be of a similar quality. They look great and fit well, however for being considered a wide they are kind of narrow but they broke in for me. I highly recommend these shoes, they should last me 4-8 months which is what I expect.
customer_reviews.author: LAWSON72

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoe, color didn't end up coming as I saw it on my screen when I ordered it, looks more purple than expected. That could just be my monitor. Otherwise a solid shoe that has held up well and is comfortable. Asics has always been the way to go for a solid comfortable running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe and has wide widths. Fit is as expected
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes. I have a wide foot as with many people I have found it is really hard to get a good pair of shoes in wide widths. I don't understand why shoe manufacturers don't understand this. I also love the cushion in these shoes. Pretty pricey but well worth the money for me. I have to admit I am no longer a runner after 37 years of running but I still do a lot of walking. Many days I put in 6 miles and these shoes feel great. I know this sounds like and exaggeration but not for someone that has ran man marathons and triathlons but now have arthritis in my knees.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald E. Hume

customer_reviews.title: they look better. I'm a runner in my late 60s and ...
customer_reviews.text: After using the gel-cumulus/nimbus shoes for several years, I switched to the Kayanos because, to me, they look better. I'm a runner in my late 60s and don't care for all the bling and flare of most of ASICS' shoes. Happily, the Kayanos feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Toe Box Too Small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these in my usual size hoping I wouldn't have the same problems as other reviewers. Unfortunately, I did. The toe box was too small and too tight. They felt like the toe part was cut off a bit too short and also the height of the shoe was tight. That was the worst part. They were pressing down on my toes from above. I ended up returning mine. I've been wearing the Kayano 21s for at least a few years and they have always fit perfectly. These 22s were a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: reesah mouse

customer_reviews.title: Given I ordered a very wide shoe I was expecting better. I've tried stretching them but I don't think ...
customer_reviews.text: After trying to wear these they are simply too narrow for my wide feet. Given I ordered a very wide shoe I was expecting better. I've tried stretching them but I don't think the fabric is as effective as leather for this process. I find myself not wanting to wear these at all and likely having to buy something else. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen R.

customer_reviews.title: Why not five stars?
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. You are probably wondering why I did not give them five stars then. Well, this is my second pair. The first pair started cracking and coming apart around the Achilles/ankle support. Since I have been an Asics fan for a while, I decided that maybe it was just a one-off issue and give them another try.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Noark

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials form holes fast
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this shoe for over a decade and have been very satisfied, but this particular shoe this time was a dud. Within a month of purchase, and having run only couple of times, the material on the inside of the heel wore away anad now there is a big hole there. Another one is forming on the other shoe as well. I would like to complain and send it back, but I don't know if they would accept it.
customer_reviews.author: JumpinJackFlash

customer_reviews.title: Good but not durable
customer_reviews.text: They were good comfortable shoes, what you expect from Asics. I was disappointed however, the padding on the heels wore out on both feet and now I am getting blisters. They only lasted about 2 months of moderate use, I was hoping they would be more durable.
customer_reviews.author: BBThree

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Support - Like Running on a Cloud
customer_reviews.text: These are the best running shoes that I've ever owned. If you have over-pronation issues and need a support shoe - then stop your search and buy the Gel Kayano. I was overweight and running hurt my knees. Someone told me that buying a better quality running shoe could help, so I tried these. When I run with these shoes, my knee pain is minimal if any, and I've lost over 50lbs.
customer_reviews.author: John Dobson

customer_reviews.title: Miss my Kayano 20s
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of the Gel Kayano 20 shoes and they fit much better. They are size 11.5, same as the new ones, and had much more room in the toes and wider in the ball of my foot. These new Kayano 22s are much tighter and almost too tight for my foot. Disclaimer: I do have a larger foot and sometimes need a wide, but my old one's were not wide and thought these would be about the same. If you have a normal sized foot, these may work for you, just not me.
customer_reviews.author: Latch001

customer_reviews.title: Buy a new pair every month.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these the first time I put them on, support and such cushioning that just wearing them made me want to run. I felt like I had Mercury's winged sandals on. But they wore too quickly. The cushioning gave and the rubber wore out. I guess that's the balance. If I were a rich guy, I'd but a new set of these every day, but alas, I am not a rich man.
customer_reviews.author: J. Edgar Mihelic, MBA

customer_reviews.title: I love Asics, so I may be a bit biased
customer_reviews.text: I love Asics, so I may be a bit biased, but these are awesome. The sole is incredibly supportive without being stiff and spongy without being soft. I easily put a few miles on during the work day and my feet don't even know it happened. The toe is very low and the fabric of the toe is quite stiff so there is not much wiggle room, however after a few runs I have found that this is not a source of discomfort, nor a real issue. I will probably stick with this model or at least this line when I wear this pair out.
customer_reviews.author: George Coyne

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: The Asics Kayano are the best for me. I'm a large runner weighing over 300lbs. I never feel pain during or after my run. These shoes provide perfect support. Unfortunately the down side of being a large runner I only get about 150-200 miles before they need replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A.

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought a second pair.
customer_reviews.text: I started having foot problems this past Spring with Plantar Factitious and a stress fracture. Have been wearing these now for two months and about 100 miles. Very comfortable so far with no continued foot issues. I purchased a second pair as I sometimes run home from work.
customer_reviews.author: NB Forrest

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for walking and ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are helping with my husband's pronation, and back issues. He is more of a walker, not a runner. He is a man of few words.. so .. the best I could get is that he likes them and they fit as expected. But if they were uncomfortable, I would've heard lots of words! LOL He does wear them every day.
customer_reviews.author: S. C. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: ... start by saying this is one of the most comfortable sneakers going
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying this is one of the most comfortable sneakers going. And I know they run about a half size small, but I had the Kayano 21 and my regular size (10), while snug, worked out alright. Not the case with this edition int he series. I swapped them out for a 10.5 and all is good. I will still have to wait for them to stretch a hair before wearing with heavy running socks...but they feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Getherall

customer_reviews.title: SOMEWHAT LIGHT ON SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is, by some planters fasciitis shoe reviewers, recommended for that condition. I found that I had to upgrade my insole insert supports for this shoe to give me the support I need for long walks. I think the removable inserts that came with this shoe would be inadequate for any wearer. With the somewhat expensive replacement inserts this shoe is very comfortable and supportive.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Another good solid shoe from Asics
customer_reviews.text: Another good solid shoe from Asics. This is my first Kayano and I have been using Nimbus and Cumulus prior for several years. I prefer the Nimbus still. The Kayano feels a bit less firm. I run a lot of trails and uneven ground and think the Nimbus is better suited. It could just be my strike pattern though. I had to go a half size higher to 13.5 for the Kayano. I am 6' 1", and 197. I run 3-4 times a week and for a total of 12-20 miles outside on ground, pavement.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly C Lucas

customer_reviews.title: My New "go-to" Every Day Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I am not a runner, but these are the most comfortable every day shoes I own. With "normal" shoes, I end every day with heel pain. I've tried heel cushions with mediocre results. I was in the Canadian Rockies and took a hike of a few miles of rocky up and down pathways, and had no heel issues.
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, just not as supportive as my Gel Nimbus or Venture 5s. Save your money and get Venture 5s.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the loose fit of these. I didn't feel as supported in my Neutral shoe as I do in Gel Nimbus or the Venture 5s. I sent these back for the Venture which were half the price and more sturdy. Been having issues with my Gel NImbus last 3 versions and wanted to try something new. These are a bit wider than the Gel Nimbus, but not as supportive to my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Okerholm

customer_reviews.title: Seems like I should have ordered a half size larger.
customer_reviews.text: I like them very much but they seem made a bit small. I have worn a size 9 1/2 running shoe since I was eighteen. I am 62 now. Do like them very much though. Next time I will order a size 10, as I use them only in the gym, it will take awhile.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes Quality Under Review
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and comfort. As a user of ASICS for about 10 years, I’ve always found th brand to give me the performance that I need. I can see with this iteration, materials are being used that can be viewed as more cheap. Especially externally. I will see if there is any negative effect. In the meantime all is well.
customer_reviews.author: Mi

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size shoes!!!
customer_reviews.text: Funny...the review I sent that indicated they sent me the wrong size shoes was omitted. This review is 5 years old but they sent it instead because it looks better. C'mon Amazon. You know better! I work in an operating room for hours on end. I don't wear Crocs, or clogs like a lot of others. I wear gel Kayano running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Marky Mark

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes out there!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best shoes I've ever owned. I've been wearing these since the 18's and have loved every pair. These are comfortable, supportive and cushioned without being stiff. The only CON is that the toe box on the 22's is defianately more narrow. I've always worn 12d but on these I had to send them back and order the E's. Once I got the new pair, I slipped them on and they fit perfectly. Great shoe and with a little shopping around, a pretty good price too ($119)
customer_reviews.author: Knuckledragger

customer_reviews.title: Best Shoe - EVER
customer_reviews.text: Best show I've ever had. I have bad ankles and knees from my military days. These shoes - no kidding - took a lot of the pressure off of my knees and ankles that other shoes couldn't. I don't care if these are for those that pronation or not - they are great for my wonky joints and I'll buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Voltron

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: My 10th grade son wears these ASICS Gel Kayano. He wears them to school as his every day shoes AND to his cross country and track practices/meets. He puts tons of miles on these. We do replace them every year to make sure the shoe gives him proper support... and by then the bottoms are getting a bit tread bare. He is a long distance runner who needs extra support.
customer_reviews.author: Toni from Michigan

customer_reviews.title: The most for the $
customer_reviews.text: As always Prime came quickly, this is first time of getting the Gel-Kayano model after buying Asics for the past 7 years. These are the most comfortable running shoes I have worn. Have had Nike, New Balance, Addidas and various Asics styles. Will not get any others.
customer_reviews.author: coach

customer_reviews.title: Very good support and cushion for your longer runs
customer_reviews.text: I already have over 300 miles on them and they holding great! I buy new ones around 550-600 miles since I only run indoors. I run a 5K few times a week. They literally still look new. The cushion is amazing on these. These shoes are very comfortable and they look good. Once they hit my max mileage, I will be wearing them with my jeans.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Gel Kayano 22's are much tighter than previous versions
customer_reviews.text: I have worn the Asics Gel Kayano for several years and have never had a problem with fit and have always gotten a very competitive price through Amazon. The Gel Kayano 22's were to replace the Gel Kayano 20's which were absolutely perfect. I was surprised in how poor the Kayano 22's fit. They were tight at the toe and walking in them for 30 minutes let alone running was agonizing. something definitely wasn't right. Fortunately, Amazon has made the whole return process very easy.
customer_reviews.author: tmlkent

customer_reviews.title: These are hands down the best shoes I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: These are hands down the best shoes I have ever owned. I am on my feet all day long and my feet feel great at the end of my 12 hour day. I used to wear New Balance 928 shoes but I could never get a whole year out of them. These Kayano 22 shoes are more comfortable and lighter. You can really feel the cushion with each step and feel the support in your arch. I only hope they last longer than 10 months, otherwise these will be the only shoes I buy from now on. Great job Asics
customer_reviews.author: Tige

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: I Got them 2 weeks ago, and ran 50 km with them. Good shoes. Compair with my Kayano 20, this Kayano 21 even better. Better support, fit well, comfortable.But I just don't like the look, not fashion enough, but still the best running for me. Will recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: M.K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect quality shoes that are worth it!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best running shoes I have bought to date. I have been running with them for a few weeks and have put over a 100 miles on them already. It is light, breathes well and really durable. Sure it's a bit pricey, but it's worth it. Never skimp on quality shoes or else you will pay for it in medical bills for joint problems in the future. I have been a fan of the Asics brand, and I still continue to be.
customer_reviews.author: Brown Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I got wide feet and low arches, this shoe makes it possible to run comfortably. If you have never tried this brand, try going to a local running store to try these out. I know there is a lot of cushioning and it fit as expected. It arrived as stated as well.
customer_reviews.author: TailorCubed

customer_reviews.title: Asics Gel Kayano is the BEST Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Asics makes the best quality running shoe on the market. The Gel Kayano has excellent cushioning and support. This shoe makes running more enjoyable and I am able to comfortably run longer distances. I have worn other top name brands over the years and have noticed their quality has diminished which caused me to find a new shoe. I have worn Ascis for about one year and am very pleased with this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: You feel like you're walking/running on clouds
customer_reviews.text: Go a half size up. Other than the sizing, these are phenomenal shoes. You feel like you're walking/running on clouds. They are durable and hold up for a very long time. I'm ordering more pairs because they are begging discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: C and N Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: these are as good as it gets
customer_reviews.text: Long time ASICS user, these are as good as it gets. Wear,comfort, looks, and durability. Usually put 1500 crosstraining miles a year on my ASICS whether they be the Kayno, Nimbus, or Cumulus brands. Mud, dirts roads, grass they really last well. Hose them off put on a fan in garage and go the next day. Materials hold up. On Nike brands not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite running shoes ever.
customer_reviews.text: I used Gel Kayano’s for over 15 years now. I did dozens of half marathons and two full marathons. I am 50 years old and these keep me away from injuries as long as I am careful and not overdo it. Best running shoes I have used. I change them once or twice a year. They last about 400-500 miles, which is normal.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dikmen

customer_reviews.title: My go to running show. I put hundreds of ...
customer_reviews.text: My go to running show. I put hundreds of miles on these running and go through a few pairs a year. I tore my plantar fascia 6 years ago and I switched to these right after. I believe if I was wearing these sneakers I would have never torn my plantar fascia.
customer_reviews.author: I smell of elderberry

customer_reviews.title: 22s seem to fit a bit differently than 21s
customer_reviews.text: I moved to this Gel Kayano 22 from the 21. I've also had others, like the 19, 17 etc. and found the 22 to FEEL surprisingly more snug. Thankfully I have a narrow foot, so these fit just fine, while previous pairs were a bit loose unless I tied them tightly. They seem to have a tiny bit higher arch, too. Overall, they have good cushioning, appear well made, and I am very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Brave TarHeel

customer_reviews.title: The best running shoe I've ever worn
customer_reviews.text: The best running shoe I've ever worn. Finally parted with my Kayano 18s, which were the previous best running shoe I've ever owned. I have a narrow foot that's a bit flat, and these feel like they're literally custom made for me. I just hope they still make them in another 5 years when I need another pair (or maybe I should buy running shoes more frequently).
customer_reviews.author: MSW1

customer_reviews.title: Kayano's are the best running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have worn the Kayano's for years and they seem to fit my feet the best of any running shoe. When I first started running I wore Nike and had terrible shin splints. I heard about ASICS started out with the GT's and the shin splints went away! I have since worked my way up to the. Kayano's and like them the best of any running shoe. Light weight, durable and good stability.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Davis

customer_reviews.title: Order In A Wider Size
customer_reviews.text: For some unknown reason ASICS changed the toe of their Gel Kayano series. I still like the shoe, but ordered this pair wider than the pair I had before because the toe from the ball of the foot forward has narrowed significantly. I mainly use my shoes for walking and have used these shoes for years even as a runner because they are designed to prevent rolling out at the ankle to which I am prone. Great comfort and arch support, I would just recommend getting these in a wide size - especially if you run so your foot has room in the shoe to expand when you hit the ground.
customer_reviews.author: dacrowesq

customer_reviews.title: ... running shoes to see if I could be more comfortable during my runs
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try something new with my running shoes to see if I could be more comfortable during my runs. These shoes are great, so far. I just have to get used to the cushion! I have had surgery on both knees to trim significant amounts of my medial meniscuses. These shoes really help with the lack of impact absorption that my knees no longer provide. Even more, the after run tenderness I used to experience seems to have been alleviated. This is a good shoe for those who need more cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Haiker

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but a little small
customer_reviews.text: I read that it runs a bit small on here and on zappos, so I got a wide. It is still very comfortable, and it's good that I got a wide because even this is a bit narrow (I never wore a wide before in any shoe). I have the same shoe in a wide + 0.5" longer and that one a bit too big - except for later on in a run when your feet start to swell a bit...then you can use the extra 0.5".
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Soft feel
customer_reviews.text: I am a recreational runner and put in about ten miles per week. These shoes have a softer feel than my last pair of running shoes, which were Brooks. My shin splints improved after getting these. I wear a 9.5 and I haven't had any issues with fit like some others have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: I wear these shoes for use on my treadmill. I bought these to replace my asics gel kayano 20's that were comfortable and I liked them well enough to buy another pair of the same type. These are the most comfortable shoes I have used on my treadmill in the 15 or so years that I have been using it. I usually replace my treadmill shoes when I have somerwhere between 300 to 500 miles wear on them.
customer_reviews.author: K L

customer_reviews.title: These are very comfortable and cushioned in the heel area
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable and cushioned in the heel area, working well for my PF. Toe is obviously pointed just by looking, even so, my toes do not feel overly cramped. Not a runner but they feel great for everyday use, runners may have a different opinion. Male, I measure on the small side of 10 1/2 these are snug for me in a their 10 1/2.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes overall, not for flat feet.
customer_reviews.text: I have flat-ish feet and these shoes were suggested. They fit well and aren't horrible when running, but after a distance you definitely feel that these aren't built specifically for flat feet or low arches. I would recommend them as comfortable shoes and they are decently stylish, but if you are wanting a miracle shoe to solve your flat feet problems, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 7.5 and got an 8 due to the reviews, they fit perfectly. I love these shoes and this is the second time I have ordered them. I plan on ordering them again when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: stephen m harper

customer_reviews.title: Beware owners of previous models: smaller shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Gel Kayano's for a number of generations. Thankfully, when the model fits well I stock up on a bunch of them, which is what I did for the GK 21's. I ordered a pair of the 22's: way too small: I run in a size 11D, and that is what has always fit me in this shoe. My toes were plastered against the front uncomfortably, and the sides were also too tight. Immediate return!
customer_reviews.author: Sanjay Aggarwal

customer_reviews.title: Like it.. but!
customer_reviews.text: I have run in Kayano for more than 10 years. Twice I have run the marathon in a pair of brand new shoes out of the box with great success. I'm glad though that I should not this time. For the first time I have experienced a new pair of Kayano has given me blisters. It is as if the finish is not quite as good as usual. One thing is that there seems to be too much fabric where the tongue is sewn on and I think that's the reason I got blisters. Very frustrating when you expect more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything else fit great and feels good
customer_reviews.text: Been a big fan of the Kayano series for many years. As they have changed the models and fit over the years it has been a bit hard to guess what size I need. I went with 12 medium for the 22 instead of a 12 wide. It is somewhat smaller than it has been in years past in the toe box. Everything else fit great and feels good. Only went on one short run so far, but the run felt good.
customer_reviews.author: R. Vanderkamp

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: Sizing too small. Ordered larger and still too small. Then I had to pay postage to return. Will not consider future purchases without free returns. Asics need to size to standards, customers should not be inconvenienced with return issues.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Too Tight
customer_reviews.text: I wear an 11 D in most shoes. These were very tight in the mid-foot and toe box was very tight. Quality of materials appears to have slipped from about 4 years ago - my last ASICS purchase. Returned them
customer_reviews.author: Just a Guy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Kayano pair, I keep coming back to these. I have short but wide feet. I used to have a problem where my pinky and thumb are pinched/pressed by the toe box, which caused great discomfort. Not any more since I found 4E width Kayano. My feet don't slip forward in the shoe even though my pinky and thumb are not pinched any more, if you know what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: kwb

customer_reviews.title: Great but narrow shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoes, but narrower than expected. I am size 9, but purchased size 10 (as you would do if you do long runs). Unfortunately, when running I discovered that after about an hour it becomes less comfortable to run, which is not good since a lot of my runs are twice as long. I guess 11 would have worked for me, but it's too late
customer_reviews.author: phys

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought a size smaller as with running shoes my experience is buy a half size down.... don't! Buy them in your size.... quick return no big deal, two days and they were replaced. Very fast turnaround! These shoes breathe so well you can feel the wind and they are like running on clouds....i have back issues.... these help tremendously!
customer_reviews.author: Josh Lightnin

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight shoe with outstanding stability and cushioning!
customer_reviews.text: The light weight Kayano has outstanding cushioning, especially in the fore foot area. It also offers great stability and is a super shoe for longer runs. I've run in Asics shoes for years, and these are my favorites. Compared to other Asics models, this shoe does run about a half size small.
customer_reviews.author: r2

customer_reviews.title: Made one old man a happy guy
customer_reviews.text: Got them for my 80 year old father who has never had a nice pair of shoes and his feet were always hurting. After he put these on, I never seen a smile so big. It cracked me up. From $7 shoes to these... It's a life changer. No more pain in his feet and he is one happy walker.
customer_reviews.author: ABates

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. I tried on probably 4 or 5 different types of Asics and sizes before deciding on these. I actually like these better than the Quantum 360's. These felt the best. Just wish I would have found them cheaper! Ha!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Kayano 20 to 22
customer_reviews.text: Been a huge Gel Kayano fan for over a decade. Asics changed the last of their venerable "wider" mens running shoe. It is narrower overall and tapers narrower sooner in the toe box. If you wore a 12(M) in the 20, you're gonna need the 12(2E) or (4E) in the 22. I tried both and stuck with the 4E. I did not try going up to a 12-1/2 in the standard width. I do not know how the Kayano 21 is lasted. Pretty sure the 23 is lasted the same as the 22.
customer_reviews.author: BT

product_meta.title: ASICS Mens Gel-Kayano 22-M Gel-Kayano 22-m
product_meta.description: True to its heritage, the new gel-kayano 22 takes a bold step forward in unsurpassed performance and modern design. The sleek new fluid fit upper is built with seamless construction and a re-engineered heel clutching system for a more secure and adaptive fit. Mild to moderate over pronators will be treated to the luxuriously plush comfort of the new comfordry lasting and comfordry x-40 sockliner sitting atop the stable fluid ride platform.
feature_bullets: Flexible performance running shoe featuring reflective and color-pop details
Heel clutching system exoskeletal heel counter
Rearfoot and forefoot GEL cushioning systems
